newsitem.title: POLAND: WOLCZANKA TO INVEST PLN 2 MLN ON CAP MKT.
newsitem.headline: WOLCZANKA TO INVEST PLN 2 MLN ON CAP MKT.

text.p: Poland's garment maker Wolczanka SA wants to invest part of its cash surplus, some two million zlotys, on the country's capital market, the company's president said.
Ryszard Polanski told Reuters on Friday the investment would likely be handled by a professional investment institution, most likely a Polish bank.
"We want to invest some 20 to 30 percent of our surplus, that is about two million zlotys, on the capital market," Polanski said.

He said Wolczanka would strive to develop its network of distribution outlets by boosting the number of its representative offices, but that the effects of the move would not be seen until the second half of next year.
The company expects a net profit of about six million zlotys this year against 6.5 million in 1995.
